properties.abstract: With the usual and Chammhalden routes this is the third itinerary on the Säntis north face (second in terms of difficulty). Steep, equipped with steel cables and marked white-blue (alpine hiking route), it leads 600 metres of vertical height to Hintere Öhrligrueb. The detour to Öhrlikopf (on the national map new "Öhrlikopf") with some scrambling in shell limestone seems more difficult than it really is. Towards the end of the tour the often crowded mountain hiking route Ebenalp-Schäfler-Säntis can be avoided by undertaking the described, demanding ridge hike.
properties.subtitle: Alpine Anatomy Lessons
properties.title: From Schwägalp via Nasenlöcher

sac_photos.title: The nostrils - the trail to the actual "holes" is a dead end
Öhrli (Öhrlikopf) viewed from Hintere Öhrligrueb at the end of the Nasenlöcher route

segments.description: From Schwägalp follow the marked roads up and down to reach Chamm and Potersalp. The bifurcation for the Nasenlöcher route is at ca. 1400 m shortly before Schwizerälpli (signpost).
segments.title: Schwägalp – Potersalp

segments.description: Ascend on the white-blue marked trail overcoming a number of escarpments and past Nasenlöcher. The upper part is a long traverse eastward to reach the picturesque Hintere Öhrligrueb. Turning eastward, you reach the saddle of P. 2117.
segments.title: Potersalp - Hintere Öhrligrueb

segments.description: On the saddle the unmarked, but easy to find ascent to Öhrlikopf begins. At first follow a faint path in the talus to reach the ridge. Overcoming an escarpment, you reach a chimney in the summit structure. Follow the chimney full of scree to the summit ridge. The descent back to Hintere Öhrligrueb is on the ascent route.
segments.title: Detour to Öhrlikopf

segments.description: Follow the white-red mountain hiking trail across the dwindling Blauschnee. The exact itinerary depends on the snow situation and climb up Himmelsleiter (steps cut into the rock) to reach the Säntis summit. Take the aerial cableway down to Schwägalp.
segments.title: Hintere Öhrligrueb – Säntis

segments.description:
Traversing Hüenerberg is an alternative to the crowded Ebenalp-Säntis hiking trail, which is 150 metres of vertical height down on karst. From the Höchnideri saddle hike pathless on karst to the ridge at P. 2246. Now follows a narrow, exposed ridge (T5) with some short climbing passages (grade I and II). P. 2311 and P. 2308 are traversed to reach Hüenerbergsattel (P. 2324), where the Chammhalden route merges from the north. From here descend a few metres southward to reach the mountain hiking trail to Säntis (T4). 
Add ½–1 h for traversing Hüenerberg.

photos.caption: Variant: following the Hüenerberg summit ridge; on the right is Girenspitz, on the left Säntis.

segments.title: Variant: across Hüenerberg
